intro: Uranthera alsinefolia, commonly known as the silverleaf uranthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a container plant due to its ornamental appeal. The leaves are covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance and drought tolerance.
